data.title: Best Mexican fusion resturant in Santa Ana
data.text:
We visited Lola G on a Friday evening so this place was packed and the wait was over 30 minutes. Let me tell you, that wait was well worth it...the food and atmosphere did not disappoint. 
Our meal started out with the Bacon covered dates, which were a little sweet and tarty at the same time. Also shared the short rib tacos with my wide, spicy but very good. 
All their drinks are also very good. I first had the LA Bomba which on the sweet side. Also, had the Mas Fuerte, which is exactly that; a stronger drink. Desserts are very good...save room for desert.
Lastly, do not forget about the kids. They enjoyed the restaurant too. I don't think they have a kids menu but they do offer kid size portions. My 8 year old son had their hamburger and he loved it.
Overall, an amazing place worth going more than once, twice...and more.

data.title: Great small plates in a casual setting
data.text: First, if you are looking for tapas in the pure Spanish sense, this place is not that place.  But, if you want great choices of small plates with Latin inspiration, this is that place.  The feel is casual, and hip.  The wines and beer choices are great and we enjoyed everyone of the many dishes we tried.  Octopus and chorizo, wonderful.  Small tacos of all sorts, ditto.  Bacon wrapped dates with blue cheese, heaven.  Go, it's fun and very tasty.

data.title: Great little place!!
data.text: We came here for dinner before a show at the yost theatre. There was 8 of us. It's really a small place. They had to sit us outside with such a large group which was fine with us. Everybody ordered something different and nobody was disappointed. We all said we would definitely come back!  Definitely make reservations!

data.title: Funky, fun and in a clever setting. Worth the visit
data.text: This restaurant is a "food fashion forward" where plates come out from the kitchen as ready and are meant to be shared. I thoroughly enjoyed the octopus. The presentation and taste reminded me of our recent trip to Spain. The tables are closely packed as in the European style and there is outdoor seating on bench tables. The bar is fully stocked and cocktails are made to order.

data.title: Amazing little gem
data.text: Lola has been a favorite of ours (those who work in DTSA) for years. Always great small menu and food prepared with pride and passion.  Just wish they would be open for lunch again.

data.title: Never like pastrami until ...
data.text: Pastrami tacos! Lola Gaspar's chef is a genius. I am far from a pastrami fan, but I sure like tacos. This dude makes his own pastrami, less salt, better smoked, so that the seasoning actually enhances rather than hides the flavor of the meat. Add a secret sauce, shredded cabbage, chicharon for texture contrast and a bit of flavor. Absolute heaven.

data.title: What a cool place !
data.text: A very bohemian vibe with cool and laid-back atmosphere. Tapas menu is quite limited but most everything on the menu is very good. Sangria was tasty but tad weak. Octopus with Merguez rocked ! So did the charred salad and skirt steak.. A bit pricey but you will leave satisfied and feeling good !

data.title: perfect diner
data.text:
Now invited some collueges. They loved it as well.
Also perfect for a diner by yourself.
Not big portions, but high quality. Just how i like it.
The Boont Amber is a perfect beer.
Just love it

data.title: Superb Food with A Twist
data.text:
Traveled to SoCal due to family emergency, and desperately needed a good meal with an old friend.  We went here at his suggestion and we're thrilled we did.  Only drawback is small, cramped dining room or uncomfortable picnic tables outdoors - we chose the latter due to warm weather.

Octopus was succulent and beyond tender - we ended up ordering a second one.  Cesar salad ok - would not get it again.  The special - house-cured pastrami tacos - were like waygu beef.  They were so tender and smokey we fought over the last one.  Sangria was a perfect accompaniment.  We will be back if in the area again.

data.title: Best Tapas Ever
data.text: I eat at a lot of great little restaurants for foodies all over the Bay Area. But in the arts district of Santa Ana, there is a gem. This was the best meal I've shared in YEARS! Bacon wrapped dates, skirt steak tacos, chicken relleno (taste and presentation) all beyond expectations - no words to describe. We were a group of 10 and everyone was in gastronomic heaven. One friend said, "How can you improve caeser salad? Well now I know." I'll let you visit to find out. Divine. Oh, and according to those who imbibed, the drinks were just as heavenly.

data.title: Consistent Excellence.
data.text:
There are few restaurants I’ve visited consistently for nearly six years. Lola Gaspar is one of them.

The first time was a bit of an off chance. While working in DTSA, I’d checked out a few of the other local restaurants and was less than impressed (Gypsy Den and Memphis, I’m looking at you), so my coworkers and I figured we’d try something else. Lola was the spot and I indulged in some amazing cola braised carnitas tacos with habanero sauce and rice. Yes, six years later and I still remember that dish. 

Too bad they’ve long since taken it off the menu.

But they’ve replaced my former favorite with some incredible new mouth-watering selections that (nearly) reach the splendor of those tacos. A few current favorites include the chile rellano and the barbacoa short rib tacos. And my wife will stab me with her fork if I try to grab the last of the bacon wrapped dates. As for dessert, go for the panna cotta if you’re looking for something refreshing to finish out your meal.

All in all, Lola Gaspar is a fantastic spot with an excellent (and ever-changing) menu and wonderful, friendly staff. Wish I could comment on their cocktails, but I still haven’t had a chance to try one yet.

data.title: Best place in town
data.text:
Food was awesome. You can order small plates.
Personnel is friendly. And it's a nice part of town.
Also if you eating by yourself you can eat on the bar and talk to some people.
A lot of young people come here and has a really nice atmosphere.

data.title: Great food, cocktails, beer & vibe
data.text: This is one of local faves. Hipster staff that is knowledgeable about their libations. Food comes in small but tasty portions.

data.title: DELICIOUS!!!!
data.text: I love to eat here because everything is given in small portions.  The potato tacos are my favorite, but everything I've had, I'VE LOVED!!!!  The staff is great and the drinks are great!!!   GO!!

data.title: Rustic Setting, Vegetarian Friendly
data.text: Lola Gaspar is located in a small quiet area of downtown Santa Ana. The block where it is situated is blocked off from vehicle traffic so there is only foot traffic outside the restaurant. We sat outside on very cute rustic wooden benches. We went on a Sunday afternoon while they were offering brunch but we had the most delicious tacos! Mine had breaded and fried avocado with a lemon slaw and my husband had the pulled pork with pickled onions. We will definitely be going back.

data.title: Perfect Before Theater Dinner
data.text: Made reservations at Lola Gaspar, based upon TA reviews, when we traveled to Santa Ana to see "Rent" at the Theater Out. This place was as great as previous reviewers have claimed. The service was fantastic! We were running late due to a traffic jam and called to postpone our reservation for 15 minutes...no problem. We were greeted warmly by Lecia who was our very attentive server for the evening. She went out of her way to explain the best selections to accommodate my lactose intolerance. My husband and I started by sharing a small plate of Jamon Iberico with the cheese on the side; it was delicious. I wanted to be adventurous and try the Smoked Cochinita Pibil; the pork wrapped in a banana leaf was moist and tender; we would order it again. Also enjoyed two Spit Roasted Pork Al Pastor tacos; I can handle the feta that was on them. We couldn't resist the dessert of Salted Butterscotch Pot De Crème...yummy! My husband drank a beer and I tried the Blazing Saddle cocktail which had just the right amount of spicy kick to it. The experience was enhanced by chatting with another small group of customers wearing "Ghost Hunter Paranormal" t-shirts.  We thought maybe that was a unique name for their band, but they turned out to be real ghost hunters who were spending the night at a local waffle restaurant. Probably the best part of our dinner at Lola Gaspar was the friendly, helpful service of Lecia. We don't get to Santa Ana often, but when we do, we will definitely dine at this restaurant again.

data.title: WOW!  Unique and Flavorful Food in a Great Setting
data.text:
LOVED dinner here a couple of weeks ago!  The food is fantastic and the ambiance is quite cool... I'm stealing someone else's "Haunted Mansion" description, because it does have that sort of dark and cool feeling about it.

We ordered the chips and guacamole, which was good and is also served with a trio of salsas.  I liked the spicy one which was hot and sweet.  We decided to do some sharing, so we ordered the crispy chicken chile rellano and the crispy rolled carnitas tacos.  OH MY GOSH!  They were both amazing!  The rolled tacos are basically a carnitas taquito and are topped with a crema, a sauce drizzle, cotija, and cilantro.  The meat is very flavorful.  My mouth is watering remembering it.  I really enjoyed these.  Next came the rellano and it was even more flavor on a plate.  I cut it in half since we were sharing.  It was a decent size and the chile is covered in a crispy breading then topped with escovitch vegetables in a tangy sauce and cilantro.  IT was seriously outstanding.  I suspect that they change the menu up pretty regularly from other reviews and photos of the menus that I've seen, which I love.

After those tasty treats, we topped it off with their butterscotch pot de creme with whipped creme and that makes me go "mmmmm".   WOW.  SOoooo tasty, sweet butterscotch with a bit of salt.  Perfect ending.

I was driving so didn't have a drink.  The husband had an IPA draft... it seems that their beer list rotates.  The cocktail menu had me very interested, so I'm hoping next time I can try a Huckleberry.  Instead I had iced tea which my server did a good job of keeping filled.

Service was good and all staff were very friendly.  Total cost was right about $50 without tip

You probably wonder why only 4 stars.  We had two issues, one was we were asked three times by different people if we wanted more chips and each time we said yes, but it took until we asked a fourth time that we actually got the chips and that was after the dessert.  Also, I understand the way they deliver the food as it becomes ready, but I'm not a huge fan of that system.  I like my food to come in an orderly manner... this will not keep me from eating here, though, because I fell in love a little bit with this restaurant.  Last problem was the single bathroom was not working and kind of a mess as well.   Had to head out to find another place to use the restroom.

Overall, this place is awesome.  I highly recommend you give it a try if in the area.  We were coming from the Anaheim Convention Center... it was about 5 miles from there and took about 10 minutes to get there.  There is a parking structure a block away, for easy parking if you don't find street parking nearby. Note that it is quite small and while they have both indoor and outdoor seating, I don't think you could fit a party any larger than about 5 people. 

They also have an Art Walk right on 2nd so it was very festive with booths and musicians playing along 2nd right outside the restaurant.

data.title: They have it ALL right!
data.text: In Town on business and over the weekend had time to visit Santa Ana.  Dinner at Lola Gaspar was outstanding.  Spontaneous stop, no reservation on a Saturday evening, but staff was very accommodating.  Short 30 minute wait, so went for a glass of wine nearby.  Seating option when we returned inside or outside.  Opted for outside under an awning that proved most helpful with the sudden rain.  Perfect.  Wait staff amazing as were the cocktails, guacamole, salsa, bacon wrapped bleu cheese stuffed figs, and assorted culinary delights.  Table share of the mac and cheese, a MUST DO.  Lola Gaspar has it figured out.  Visit there and sure you will enjoy!

data.title: Just about perfect!
data.text: What a great restaurant should be.  Excellent service. Hand shanken cocktails.  Food so freshly made I had to wait for it to finish cooking (short ribs).  The food was delicious!  Wish there was a place like this in our town!

data.title: A Santa Ana Gem
data.text: I would have never found this place until my friends decided to show me around downtown Santa Ana. I had no idea there was so much more to the area. Friendly atmosphere, a delicious tapas menu (ex: duck mac n cheese, bacon wrapped dates) and crafty cocktails. I wish I knew of this place when I lived there, as I would have become a regular.
